Title: World's tourist hubs, 'ghost towns' for how long?

Content: The government looks set to organise 343 marketing activities both in and outside Thailand and accelerate free trade agreement talks with several potential partners.

Content: For many weeks now, anti-government protests have converged at different locations in Bangkok almost on a daily basis, although the gatherings are anything but protracted. Title: Prayut sings praises of new finance minister

Title: Thammasat asked to reconsider rally ban
Content: Thammasat University's Tha Prachan campus has become the subject of conflict between student-led protesters insisting on staging a rally there, and former rector Kaewsan Atibodhi opposing it. The school, meanwhile, rejected a proposal by the group to hold a rally there next week.

Content: A field hospital may be opened in Mae Sot district if Covid-19 infections prove too much for the main local hospital to handle, said governor Pongrat Piromrat on Wednesday.

Title: Govt urged to expand child help
Content: Child protection advocates yesterday marked National Children's Day by urging the government to set aside 30 million baht to include the 4.2 million young children nationwide into its child welfare programme.

Title: Covid-infected mum's baby is virus-free
Content: A 28-year-old Covid-19 infected woman gave birth to a baby girl at Rajavithi Hospital in Bangkok and her baby was virus-free, according to Department of Medical Services director-general Somsak Akkasilp.

Title: Infected governor 'improving'

Title: Lao dam construction draws complaint from Bangkok
Content: 5The Lao government's decision to construct the Sanakham dam, a run-off reservoir on the Mekong River, caused concerns about territorial security in Bangkok. The government recently sent a message to Vientiane, saying Thailand may not end up purchasing the power generated by the 684-megawatt hydroelectric dam -- which will be located just two kilometres from the Thai border in Loei -- if the issues aren't addressed.

Content: Curbs on mass gatherings, restricted movement in and out of disease-control areas and restricted movement of migrant workers are among the rules that will be strictly enforced under the emergency decree to curb the new outbreak of Covid-19, the government says.

Content: Bangkok and Phetchaburi lead in terms of new local Covid-19 cases, with 18 and seven respectively, as 110 cases are added. A new cluster is also found linked to a gambling den in Rayong.

Title: Anek sticks to plan for Thailand's 'moonshot'
Content: The Minister of Higher Education Science Research and Innovation Anek Laothamatas has ignited debate on social media once more after reiterating Thailand's "mission to the moon" will be accomplished within seven years, using a budget of "only 3 billion baht".

Content: Rapid-result testing will be used to detect Covid-19 infections in Samut Sakhon while more beds will be arranged at a field hospital.

Content: A deadly shooting at a gambling den in Bangkok on Aug 3, in which four people were killed, opened a can of worms for police, even though the accused gunman turned himself in to face charges.

Title: Heinous crime: Mass shooting in Nakhon Ratchasima
Content: With the public still reeling from the violence in Lop Buri, the country was shocked by a mass shooting in Nakhon Ratchasima on Feb 8 that left 30 people dead, including the gunman, and 58 others injured.

Title: Heinous crime: Death of 'Nong Chompoo' stumps police
Content: The death of a three-year-old girl, Nong Chompoo, in Mukdahan's Dong Luang district in May is a case that has left police baffled. Hundreds of people have been interviewed with a number coming under police suspicion, but there has never been enough evidence to seek an arrest warrant.

Title: Heinous crimes that shocked us in 2020
Content: As the year nears its end, we look back at five tragic and mysterious crime stories that both captivated and appalled the nation during the year.

Title: 32 Thais in South Korea test positive for Covid-19
Content: Thirty-two Thai workers in South Korea have tested positive for Covid-19 as health care workers there await test results of 28 more, according to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

Title: Heinous crime: 'Ice Metal Casket' and the hidden bodies in his home
Content: Apichai Ongwisit, 40, alias "Ice Metal Casket" was arrested in January this year for alleged involvement in the killing of 22-year-old Warinthorn Chaiyachet, but police have yet to complete a search of all his property -- a 20-rai compound in Bang Kae district of Bangkok where more than 300 human bone fragments were found.

Title: Court acquits nine of sedition
Content: The Bangkok South Criminal Court yesterday acquitted nine activists charged with sedition and holding an illegal protest within 150 metres of a royal palace in January 2018.

Title: Protesters prepare to resume next year
Content: After months of street demonstrations that have shaken Thailand's establishment, the best-known figures of a movement that drew tactics and inspiration from protests in Hong Kong said they are at a critical juncture.

Title: Less work, more travel, the medicine for 2021 recovery
Content: The government is considering a proposal from travel agents for extra holidays next year to aid the ailing domestic tourism sector, which is being further savaged by the domestic reemergence of the coronavirus.

Title: Fresh lockdown warning
Content: The authority handling the Covid-19 pandemic in Thailand issued a stark warning on Friday: cooperate with our guidelines or there will be a nationwide lockdown by March.

Title: Fugitive monk arrested in killing of colleague
Content: KHON KAEN: A 53-year-old monk who had fled after killing another monk in a rice field in Muang district of Khon Kaen early this year was caught on Friday at a drink-drive checkpoint in Chaiyaphum on the way to a temple.

Title: 46 new Covid cases, excluding migrant dorms
Content: New Covid-19 cases include 39 local infections and seven quarantined arrivals, but the government witholds details of infected migrant workers.

Title: Elephant Santas spread virus awareness in Ayutthaya
Content: BANGKOK - Christmas and Thailand's love of elephants combined Wednesday when four of the giant creatures dressed as Santa turned up at a school in Ayutthaya, complete with huge coronavirus masks.

Title: Samut Sakhon-related case in Nakhon Si
Content: NAKHON SI THAMMARAT: A trader in Samut Sakhon has tested positive for Covid-19 after she returned to her home in Tha Sala district of this southern province, governor Kraisorn Wisitwong announced on Wednesday.

Title: Myanmar woman arrested for illegal entry
Content: KANCHANABURI: A Myanmar woman was arrested by soldiers on Wednesday morning for illegal entry through Sangkhlaburi district.

Title: Samut Sakhon outbreak reaches Phuket
Content: PHUKET: A Phuket man has been diagnosed with Covid-19 after being in close contact with a friend from Samut Sakhon who was infected with the virus.

Title: Three cases in Korat, all went to Samut Sakhon
Content: NAKHON RATCHASIMA: Three local people who recently visited Samut Sakhon province have been found infected with the novel coronavirus - two seafood vendors and a local official.

Title: Covid-zone workers dumped in Samut Prakan
Content: SAMUT PRAKAN: Fourteen Myanmar workers at a factory in Covid-19-plagued Samut Sakhon province were rushed off the premises and abandoned in neighbouring Samut Prakarn's Bang Phli district on Tuesday night.

Title: State officials told to stay home
Content: The prime minister on Tuesday ordered state officials to work from home from tomorrow until Sunday in a bid to keep PM2.5 dust levels in check.

Title: Nataphol calls off most O-Net exams
Content: Prathom 6 and Mathayom 3 students will not have to sit the Ordinary National Education Test (O-Net) for the 2020 academic year, according to the Ministry of Education.

Title: Cabinet approves relief for jobless
Content: The cabinet has approved relief payments to subscribers of the Social Security Fund who have been made jobless by the Covid-19 pandemic.

Title: Shrimp farmers to get help
Content: The Commerce Ministry's Department of Internal Trade (DIT) is gearing up to provide assistance to shrimp farmers in the wake of the 14-day lockdown in Samut Sakhon.

Title: Schools shut amid Covid fears
Content: More schools in Bangkok and Pathum Thani were ordered to close on Tuesday due to concerns over the spread of Covid-19.

Title: Virus fear threatens New Year
Content: PM Prayut signalled a halt to the easing of travel restrictions and the reimposition of tough disease control measures, including a potential ban on New Year's celebrations

Title: Migrant 'escapes' denied by governor
Content: The Samut Sakhon governor yesterday dismissed rumours that migrant workers had escaped from an apartment building behind the shrimp market at the centre of the Covid-19 outbreak.

Title: Pattaya cancels year-end bash
Content: Pattaya City municipality has cancelled its New Year countdown due to worries over a possible second wave of Covid-19 infections following the virus outbreak in Samut Sakhon.

Title: Wat Tham Mongkhon abbot dies at 100
Content: Somdet Phra Yannawachirodom, a revered monk and the abbot of Wat Tham Mongkhon in Bangkok's Phra Khanong district passed away yesterday morning at the age of 100 and after 80 years in the monkhood, according to an announcement posted on the temple's Facebook page.

Title: Xaysana's life term 'final'
Content: The Supreme Court has rejected a Lao drug kingpin's request to appeal his life sentence for smuggling more than a million ya ba pills into Thailand.

Title: Outbreak pro transferred in
Content: The Public Heath Ministry has appointed an epidemiologist from Phangnga to spearhead the fight against the Covid-19 outbreak in Samut Sakhon, said permanent secretary Kiatiphum Wongrajit.

Title: Charge for obstructing ambulance
Content: A drunk driver who blocked an ambulance on its way to pick up a patient who later died before reaching the hospital could face a charge of negligence leading to death, according to police in Samut Prakan province.

Title: Cabinet approves relief for jobless
Content: The cabinet has approved the Labour Ministry's proposal to pay relief compensation to subscribers of the Social Security Fund (SSF) who have been made jobless by the Covid-19 pandemic, government spokeswoman Rachada Dhnadirek said on Tuesday.

Title: PM: Harsher disease control
Content: Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha signals stricter disease-control measures and a halt to travel easing as the country is grappling with a surge in Covid-19 cases.

Title: Two more Myanmar people in Mae Sot test positive
Content: TAK: Two Myanmar nationals who were among 120 people deemed at risk in Mae Sot district for Covid-19 infection tested positive on Tuesday and were quarantined.

Title: 32 Lao nationals caught in Tak Bai for illegal entry
Content: NARATHIWAT: Thirty-two Lao nationals were arrested by Thai authorities after they crossed the Sungai Kolok river from Malaysia into Thailand on Tuesday morning.

Title: Bangkok irrigation officials infected during visit to Samut Sakhon
Content: Two engineers of the Royal Irrigation Department in Bangkok were diagnosed with Covid-19 after visiting a restaurant in Samut Sakhon province, the epicentre of the latest outbreak of the disease.

Title: Sedition case against Chaturon dismissed
Content: The Criminal Court on Tuesday dismissed charges of sedition brought by the military junta against former deputy prime minister Chaturon Chaisaeng six years ago under Section 116 of the Criminal Code and the Computer Crimes Act.

Title: Pattaya New Year countdown cancelled
Content: The Pattaya City municipality has cancelled the New Year countdown on worries over a possible second wave of Covid-19 infections following the virus outbreak in Samut Sakhon.

Title: Ja New's mother cleared of lese majeste
Content: The Criminal Court on Tuesday dismissed four-year-old lese majeste charges against Patnaree Chankit, mother of political activist Sirawith Seritiwat, alias Ja New, filed under Section 112 and the Computer Crimes Act.

Title: Patient dies after motorist obstructs ambulance
Content: A motorist who obstructed an ambulance rushing to pick up a patient faces another serious charge on top of drink-driving after the 46-year-old man died.

Title: Supreme Court confirms life sentence for Lao drug kingpin
Content: Supreme Court rejects Lao drug kingpin's request to appeal his life sentence for smuggling more than a million "yaba" pills into Thailand.
